content: easy breezy shawl a simple shawl that is easy to remember and works up like a dream great for showing off the natural beauty of your yarn materials needed 1 ball lion brand mandala yarn or similar weight/yardage h hook 5mm yarn needle as always all row that begin with a double_crochet are done using the no turning chain double_crochet video tutorial available on youtube if for whatever reason you do not wish to do the no turning chain double_crochet you may begin your row with ch2 or ch3 however you prefer i also begin the shawl with a magic_ring magic_ring if you prefer to begin another way absolutely use the method that you are most comfortable with using turn after every row special stitch shell 2dc ch2 2dc all in same chain space begin with magic_ring row 1 4dc ch2 4dc row 2 2dc in first double_crochet ch1 sk1 double_crochet in next st ch1 skip 1 shell in ch2 ch1 sk1 double_crochet in next st ch1 skip 1 2dc in last st row 3 2dc in first st double_crochet in ea st and chain to ch2 space shell in ch2 double_crochet in ea st and chain to last st 2dc in last st row 4 2dc in first st ch1 sk1 double_crochet in next st ch1 sk1 repeat to ch1 skipping over st before ch2 shell in ch2 ch1 sk1 double_crochet in next st ch1 sk1 repeat to last st 2dc in last st repeat row 3-4 to desired size ending on a row 3 this shawl is basically alternating solid double_crochet row with mesh row make sure to put two double_crochet in every first and last st for every mesh row you will not work into the double_crochet on either side of the ch2 it s very easy to figure out if you ve made a mistake i made many… there was much frogging because something will go wrong either near the center spine or at the end of the row time for a crudely-drawn chart
